title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: To determine if a reaction is spontaneous, consider the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG). A negative ΔG indicates a spontaneous reaction.

title: Calculating Gibbs Free Energy
text: Use the equation $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$, where ΔH is the enthalpy change, T is the temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is the entropy change. If ΔG is negative, the reaction is spontaneous.

title: Standard Electrode Potentials
text: Consider the standard electrode potentials (E°) of the half-reactions. A positive cell potential (E°cell) indicates a spontaneous reaction.

title: Calculate E°cell
text: Use the equation $$E\degreecell=E\degreecathode-E\degreeanode$$. If E°cell is positive, the reaction is spontaneous.
